website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay more up front for these dumbbells, but their easy adjustability puts them well ahead of competitors.
pros: A top choice for its easy weight adjustments and innovative dial system for a customized workout
cons: There's a bit of a learning curve for those who are used to traditional dumbbells

website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for adjustable dumbbells that will keep up with a full-body workout, this high-end weight set won't disappoint.
pros: Innovative weight selection process eliminates the need to unscrew collars and remove plates, reducing time between sets
Allows for precision weight adjustment in increments that work well for both smaller and larger muscle groups
cons: No option to add additional weight, but the existing 52.5 pounds is more than enough for beginners to intermediates

customer_reviews.title: Barely used but broke anyway
customer_reviews.text: I only used this a few times. One of the two dumbbells is stuck with one of the “disks”/ weights on it. It doesn’t twist so I can not remove or add any weights. So unusable. If anyone has any tricks to get it twisting again let me know. I don’t want to spend tons of money on shipping to use the warranty
customer_reviews.author: BBD

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months - Unable to contact seller for replacement
customer_reviews.text: Like the dumbbells but they have broken with normal/recommended usage after only 8 months. One of the 2 dumbbells not longer rotates and a black plastic piece broke off. I'm trying to contact seller to see if I can get a replacement dumbbell but finding it impossible to contact the seller. I'm disappointed considering the set is now worthless and these were not cheap. If anyone knows how to contact the seller please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Mugs

customer_reviews.title: Going rate is $500. Over 30% of going rate is price gouging.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair if these. The handle cracked on the one weight and 2 of the weight settings no longer work. The weights just fall off now. Also, I bought the Selecttwch 552 models for under $500. I called Bowflex and these should be available again in June or July of this year for around that price. 30% over the going rate is price gouging. Do the math if these are for sale at $1500.00 it does not take a rocket scientist to see this. A reasonable and prudent person would see this is breaking the law. These items should be pulled or banned for sale for exploiting the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie K. Haus

customer_reviews.title: Great weights for $300. Not sure about $1500.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in 2018 for $299. Use them all the time, they are well made and work great. But at the pandemic price of $1500??? That’s crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mac

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great at first. Bought this for my boyfriend for a birthday gift and not even two months later of him using them maybe three times a week one doesn't work anymore. The locking mechanism broke and none of the weights will even attach to one side at all. Waste of money, wish I could return this product 😔
customer_reviews.author: A.D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Love the product.... not happy with the price gauging
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for $279 Jan. 2020 And now they’re $1200?! That sucks. But overall I’m am happy with my purchase. Don’t buy here for that price people. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew&Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box dials didn’t work. Bought it to replace old one. Same poor quality as the old one.
customer_reviews.author: javier andrade

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2014 for $299.00
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy these for over $300. Great product, but at current CV-19 prices, I would recommend you get creative and find other methods for strength training.
customer_reviews.author: theutopianking

customer_reviews.title: Weights are great. but this price is WRONG!!
customer_reviews.text: Weights are great... but this price is WRONG!! We bought these weights in March as you can see in my picture and only paid $279 for them!!! $1500 is taking advantage of people during this pandemic and you should be ashamed!!
customer_reviews.author: nanny on the run

customer_reviews.title: Great home gym essential
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great addition to your home gym. However, I purchased this for $300 in 2017. Now with COVID-19, the price has jumped up to $1300...insane!
customer_reviews.author: Home is Where the Heart Is

customer_reviews.title: Holy moly
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this when I did. 236$ plus tax and prime shipping. Now its 1,100$ plus 70$ shipping, maybe cuz of the coro a virus, everyone wants these. Haha great, but it's not 1,200$ great.
customer_reviews.author: guilherme gomez

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing quality!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing a set of these. Loved my first set and worked great for years. The new set however not so much. Seems to be quite a few issues with the selector working correctly. One of them has completely stopped working for no reason after two months of use. For how much these cost you would think they would work properly for a long period of time. So giving it one star for quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sickler

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Unless I simply have terrible luck this was about the craziest thing I’ve ever spent $300+ on. Both sets were stuck off the bat. Finally after shaking them around for a while one budged. The second set took me much longer. Not efficient at all during a high intensity workout. Or any workout for that matter. Save your money! Not worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Home Gym Success
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in January and have been using them about 5 days a week, on average. We moved out of an apartment that had a gym into a house, so these have enabled me to use a little space in the garage to keep my workouts up without the gym costs and shared equipment. With the cost of some gyms near $100/Mo, these along with a bench, pull up bar, and other basic equipment can start saving you money after less than a year. Aside from a cable machine and a few machines for legs, I can't say I miss the gym at all - these are great!
customer_reviews.author: John Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today, Dials are stuck.
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today. one pair works great and all the dials work. It's pretty awesome. However the 2nd dumbbell is stuck due to the fact that one of the dials will not move and is stuck on 52.5. Have not seen anything online that works. Real shame as i was looking forward to using these tonight, but instead i have to contact customer support and see what they can do about it. Will change review if they can help me figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: This product is a waste of money. We bought it for a 2019 Christmas present for our son. The system is constantly locking up. As a family we attempted to use the system during this pandemic with little success. January 31st was the latest we could return, so we missed the opportunity. There should be a manufacturers warranty on this product. I don’t recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed Customer
customer_reviews.text: Even after contacting Bowflex and getting plates replaced it still gets stuck and sometimes takes me 15-20 minutes to fuss with to get the weights to release and change weight and that is a horrible inconsistence mid workout. They keep wanting me to trouble short but I just can’t keep trouble shooting all the time. I see nothing visibally wrong and I am no professional so I don’t know what to look for. I have followed all the directions in the manual, don’t drop them, treat them well, and only started using them a little while ago and after only 3 months I am frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Sara H Golieb

customer_reviews.title: Not a bang for your bucks
customer_reviews.text: Broken many times. It slips out of your hand without any grip, takes too much space, I recommend just buy a whole set of regular dumbbell
customer_reviews.author: James Meng

customer_reviews.title: Broke & locked up after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Started off great, But the knob to adjust the weights locked up after a few weeks, and you can’t get them to budge. Now I’m stuck with a 60+ lb block.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Voyles

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you actually plan on lifting
customer_reviews.text: Gets stuck all the time (maybe 5-6 times during a workout, and the weights won’t even come out of the holder when it’s stuck) and takes a lot of work to get unstuck. You will prob spend about 10x the time messing with it as actually lifting. Probably super unsafe as well. Most of the 5 star reviews are probably from people who don’t actually lift and tried it once as a New Years resolution.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: These things are really not good, true I would like to use harsher language.
customer_reviews.text: The simple thing at the beginning was the handle was too small, so added rubber grips to fix that. But as of the last week, it's impossible to adjust, and worse yet after you finally adjust it, you then have to pry the weight out of the plastic tray. If I had known how worthless the plastic tray would make these weights I would not have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: $300 paperweights
customer_reviews.text: I've probably used these 3 times. When i used them i didn't really go all out because i was afraid i was going to damage the locking mechanis. Well it seems to have happened anyway. The weights are locked into the base, knobs won't turn. Ive tried troubleshooting, nothing. If i turn them over they weights dislodge but then the individual plates don't stay. I was sceptical about these but gave them a try because overall Bowflex is a good company. These however are not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: will l brown

customer_reviews.title: Unit broke after 1 month DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time this unit has broken, dial for setting weights is broken so weights cannot be adjusted Cheap and awful product, window for return was so short i cannot return
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jacobus

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Weights!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE! I've had mine for three months, used them semifrequently, and now they're broken. One side won't pick up weights, and the other side won't let any go! I've tried everything -- including returning them, which Amazon won't let me do. These are real crap you guys -- and I'm a long-history Bowflex customer. Really disappointed in the quality...especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sellers Sims

customer_reviews.title: Ginormous piece of over-priced garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ginormous piece of over-priced garbage. Broke after using these after only 3 workouts. The locking mechanisms locked up for no reason after just a few days, rendering the weights useless and locked into the base of the weights. The turning mechanisms completely locked up. Do not buy this product. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Chris mccauley

customer_reviews.title: Selector prone to malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was the move or sitting unused for a few months, but the selectors are not working like they used to. I brought them with me when I moved from Oregon to Washington, and I'll be damned if I can get the selectors to work as smoothly as they did when the dumbbells were brand new. Trying to mount them on the stand, and trying to do so with the dumbbells off of the bases, but they don't want to let go. Edited to add: it's the 2.5 lb plates that are causing problems. I lifted up the bare 5-lb bar removed the 2.5-lb plates, and the selectors had no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jamin Koehn

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. Expected more from Bowflex. The base rack is terrible. Had to work with support to get them out of the base rack and still from time to time, the plates stick. Also, they are too long. Can't perform certain exercises correctly or safely due to being to long (worse for short or small individuals). I wouldn't buy these cheap at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not balanced. Loose plate. Design issue.
customer_reviews.text: Balance: since it needs indentations for each plate to get on and off, the balance is actually an issue. Not extremely obvious, but you can feel a little bit strange. Safety: the plates don’t firmly stay there. Sometimes they fall off. For me, small plates fell off several times when I had already adjust the gear at right position. Design: the shape of the side is small, when you wanna hold them on you thighs, they are as stable as the ones you use in gym whose intact surface is large enough. It’s a good choice during quarantine but the price and product don’t match that well.
customer_reviews.author: Mingzhe Yu

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily don't waste your money. Can't replace them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these awhile ago. Didn't use them for awhile, but when I did I used them maybe 3 times and one set already broke. Completely unusable now! Not worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Halli

customer_reviews.title: Okay but I wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: They worked well for a couple of years but now it seems possible to wedge them into the stand incorrectly, which leaves the weights stuck and the knob unable to turn. I was able to pull it out eventually and then I could see that the weights were not aligned correctly. I pulled each one out and set it back in so that the metal notches are all aligned and then the system begins working again. Another issue I have with this weight set is, it's quite long. So, when doing an overhead press, you can easily knock the two sides together.
customer_reviews.author: tnk479

customer_reviews.title: FALSELY ADVERTISED COUNTERFIETS
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy these! They are advertised as "bowflex" but the product sent to you is a cheap knockoff with no branding what-so-ever. The weights don't fit properly into the base, so you can only adjust one side at a time, before having to shift the weight and adjust the other side. Everything feels extremely flimsily made. This is a huge false advertisement scam, looking to charge you full-price for brand-name workout equipment, but send you off brand garbage. Save your money, and shop elsewhere. Buyers beware. Complete and total ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these weights for a couple years. They are very easy to adjust and do exactly what they advertise. I’d recommend the stand as well. The components that handle the weight adjustments are a very strong plastic. I’ve never had any concerns with weights falling off, but one of the adjustment plates did break once and no longer allowed me to select a few weight settings. Good news is all of those parts are replaceable. Replaced the damaged plate for about $20 and good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Overall, meh....
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few years now and I'm pretty disappointed. First of all, they are bulky and that limits proper motion like tricep kickbacks. More of an issue is the cheap plastic bases. They feel like they are always about to break and don't hold up well. The issue is that without these the weights will become useless. Let me explain how I feel about these. If I could do it again I wouldn't buy these, yet I don't have plans to replace them until they almost certianly will break.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great weights but be aware of inflated
customer_reviews.text: These are great weights, very easy to change through weights. They, on occasion do get stuck, but easy to set them right. Unfortunately they are out of stock currently (due to covid19 demand) and there are other buying options that are inflated quite a bit -as in 100% inflated. Please be aware of that before you decide to buy
customer_reviews.author: Tuhin Joshi

customer_reviews.title: I’m Surprised Bowflex Hasn’t Been Sued Over These
customer_reviews.text: LONGTERM REVIEW: They where great for about two years....until.... Two days ago I was doing squats with these weights and guess what? Two of the weights FELL OUT and hit my foot. These are DANGEROUS. Imagine if someone was doing an over the head exercise and one of the weights fell out and hit them in the face and knocked them out? You gotta be kidding me. I want my money back for these dangerous products. I cant trust these things AT ALL to not fall on my feet? Jesus.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Clark

customer_reviews.title: all in all worth the money
customer_reviews.text: All in all these are a good value. Pros: Easy to adjust. Saves a ton of space. Well balanced. Heavy enough to get a good workout in. Love doing presses, rows, shrugs , and most delt movements. Cons: At first they were sticking (this got better with use). Very bulky for the size weight they max out to. Standard bicep curls feel a bit awkward due to size. Goblet Squats I question if they will cause wear in time but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Weights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of weights just before covid hit, I use them in conjunction with the digital Peliton app now that I am not going to the gym. They are very well made and easy to use. The locking mechanism works very smoothly. For me, the best feature is the adjustability, from 5 to 52 lbs is a nice small package. My only complaint, which I have seen in videos, is they are very wide and can get in the way but I have quickly adjusted to them. Perfect product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve10134

customer_reviews.title: Waste of space, but still kinda cool
customer_reviews.text: These weights work as you expect them to work. Turn the dial to the appropriate weight and lift. The dumbell will lift only the amount of weight that you choose, so it's pretty neat. But the big drawback are the huge plates. For almost any weight that you select, the dumbell ends up being huge. And this can be a big problem when you're trying to do certain exercises. Look for photos of how the weights during use before you purchase this
customer_reviews.author: MOJO

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled! They work great!
customer_reviews.text: I lucked out and bought these when a $50 coupon was offered. I've had a previous set of selec-tech that only go up to 20lbs. Bought them 10 years ago and recently needed more weight now that I've gotten in shape again. These new ones have a smoother selection action on the ends and they lift out of the cradle easier. I'm really happy I got them and I'll keep the old ones in case a friend works out with me. A great investment and well worth the $
customer_reviews.author: S.K. in O.R.

customer_reviews.title: Too Long!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea that I would have 2 dumbbells to do all the weights. The weights are easy to adjust to the appropriate range. The thing I don’t like is how long they are! I understand why they have to be long, but goodness! I think they do the job, but shoulder presses etc for someone who is on the petite side, I always worry I am going to hit myself in the head.
customer_reviews.author: baby e's mommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for at home workouts
customer_reviews.text: I got these cause of the quarantine. I was a little worried cause other reviewers were saying that their's would get jammed and what not. After about a weeks worth of use, I haven't run into any problems. The weights themselves latch on fairly well and I haven't had them jam on me yet. Super stoked I got these I'm glad it doesn't take up too much space. I genuinely love the fact that I bought one dumbbell but it converts into like 5 different weight categories.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and a great option for smaller spaces (like my apartment). They're longer than the typical dumbbell, so a few moves can be bit awkward, but they work very well otherwise. Selecting different weights is easy, and the plates are solid when locked into place.
customer_reviews.author: Psi Guy

customer_reviews.title: Space saving but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want a whole rack taking up a ton of room in my garage gym, these sounded like the answer. But since the length of them never changes, for some exercises they just feel too big/long. I would still recommend them, but it isn't a true replacement for an actual set, just a great space saving feature. Also, these aren't the heavy ones, so dont need to drop, but if you are somebody that feels the 52.5lbs setting is heavy for bench (105) and would drop the weights on last set, I think it would wear these out and break them over time. For that reason for a heavy set I will pony up and buy urethane covered heavy set
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Really easy, compact, fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best investment on workout equipment I can have. It's really compact and well made, well balanced. I didn't buy the bench but am debating when the price goes down. The weights are easy to use and the instructions are well written. I don't have complaints except maybe should have gotten a heavier set. Make sure you don't do weights over anything or do any pushups or lean on them because they are not meant to be used that way. The weights are rather large so you may have to be careful on the range of motion, but just be wary of your routine and movements and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Tong

customer_reviews.title: Slightly big for females.  Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Got these on a great deal since I waited for Black Friday and the price seemed to fluctuate a LOT. I think I paid $240. A little big to hold since I'm a 5'3" female, but definitely worth having most of the workout equipment I need in a small package like this. Took 2 delivery people to drag it to my door and inside...they did not look happy lol. I like that they're wide enough that when I do tricept extension standing, I just hold on to the dials of a single dumbbell. I do wish the dials were slightly smaller. My boyfriend has had a pair for about 7 years and held up great with near daily use!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my equipment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these ( and a separate bench). I like the versatility and the selectors work flawlessly. I try not to drop the weights or clank them together and they still function perfectly. I first wanted the stand but decided against as it does not bother me to bend over to select new weight. BTW the app is pretty nice and the 6 week workout was a great way to start out. I am 6,0 Male and 213 lbs. in decent shape. The 52.5 lbs is good enough for me. If I want to do heavy lift for bench then I use a Olympic bar. Price is good compared to buying individually. Quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set of dumbells!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful for a home gym. I highly recommend you get a stand for them. I purchased a different stand than the Bowflex brand and it works very well for far less money than the Bowflex stand. But....the weights are excellent. They are secure and accurate. They take up very little space and you get a wide range of dumbell weights. It is quick and easy to change the weights. The only downside is that they are a little bigger than standard dumbells but once you get used to that, its no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Greg's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and will not last!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total Crap! Used about half a dozen times and they are already broken. Cheap plastic rings that hold plates on, crack and now are useless. Would love to have my money back???
customer_reviews.author: Mo-man

customer_reviews.title: When technology meets your biceps! The results are explosive!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is super cool technology. I was a little skeptical at first, and I was actually about to purchase some traditional weights instead, but my wife is a personal trainer whose used these before, and she gave them her seal of approval. That was good enough for me. Been using them for a few weeks now, and I really like them. I always hated how with traditional weights, you have to take weight off, put it on, then fasten the two clasps on both ends of both dumbbells, wash, rinse, repeat (that was exhausting just writing it, let alone doing it). These save me all that time and that is a huge plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: C Stew

customer_reviews.title: Easy to switch from weight to weight.
customer_reviews.text: Used manual dumbbells with spinner ends for years. Purchased the 552s and have been extremely happy. Switching weight loads on the fly is incredibly easy. No more lifting heavier weights than necessary (risking injury due to bad form) because of the inconvenience of changing plates on manual dumbbells between sets. The rubber grips work well. I had to use weightlifting gloves on the old manual dumbbells with the textured metal grips due to callouses on my palms and fingers that developed. I no longer need gloves with the 552s. Purchased the stand, as well, which is helpful. It prevents back strain from constantly picking up weights from the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C.

customer_reviews.title: Junk. One weight is stuck for unknown reasons.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. I treat this very carefully and never ever drop them. Like all my stuff I keep it up well. This out of no where jammed up and won’t come unstuck and won’t remove from the storage container. Total garbage as there is no release to unjam it.
customer_reviews.author: MrMP

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DONT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE.. it broke when using it after three months the dumbbell locked and would not go back into the platform.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent knock-off and NOT a Bowflex item
customer_reviews.text: The product is fraudulently advertised through Wintop as a Bowflex 552 adjustable dumbell weight. What I received is a cheap feeling adjustable dumbell which is only labeld as "DUMBELL". This item also does not have the mechanical feel of the adjustable mechanism like a Bowflex and therefore I don't feel like I can trust it when lifting overhead or in any position.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bradbury

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient near max weights
customer_reviews.text: If you are usually using the entire weight or near the max weight, the friction between the frame and the plates tends to be enough to pick up the frame and the remaining weights. As such, when you go to pick the dumbbells up, you end up picking up the dumbbells and the frames. This was an acceptable inconvenience until it eventually led to the dumbell interlock breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Adam F. F.

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Waited over a month for these to finally come in. CATCH... this may not be for all orders but this came in looking really nice.. but once I picked it up and adjusted the latch to different weighs.. THE LATCH DOES NOT WORK AND IT STAY ON 1 WEIGHT.. i'm so frustrated because I waited over a month to be able to use this but it came in broken and basically useless. I do not want to have to go through the trouble of exchanging it because it's such a long waiting period or turn around. Now I'm just taking a lost of $330.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Superior Product
customer_reviews.text: I’d give more than 5 stars if I could. These dumbbells are very high quality, easy to navigate and overall a terrific product. Great weight distribution. Kudos to the seller who got them to me in a week and to the Amazon delivery man who brought this 105 pound package up the stairs right to my second floor apartment in great condition. Easy to un-box as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A De Simone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome addition to my gym
customer_reviews.text: This was a big investment so it took me a while to decide if I want to buy it. I have been doing more weight lifting and I found I wanted to slowly move up the weight size but not have to buy each little addition. I also wanted something that was easy to move out of the way so I could use the space for something else when not working out. I am really happy I decided to buy these. They are easy to move between weights, slide out of the holder nicely, turn easily and have held up under use as well as moving several times.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Decent w/ a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to quickly change weight when working out. A couple cons would be sometimes it doesn't lock and unlock correctly at the right weight and needs to be jiggled around a little. Also the weird shape of the hand takes some getting use to, its not perfectly cylindrical like most dumbbells are. But even with these two issues, it does make up more than enough by allowing me to having the weight options in a much smaller space. I've had it for a few months now and its held up well.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: DO YOU EVEN LIFT BROOooo?!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you again FKD!! One of the best decision and investment in self I have made! Paid $329 patience is key because unless you have it to pay more than that price, do not waste your time or money spending more than $400-$450 Tops! Came out the box locked could not move the dial. Looked on YouTube found a video called “How to tutorial select tech” and boom I was on my way!! I hope that you enjoy yours like I am enjoying mine. Good Luck!!
customer_reviews.author: VixenAnswers

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, they’re pretty awesome. But sometimes they get stuck and you can’t turn the knob or pull them out. Takes some shaking and swear words to fix it, which my husband is always glad to provide! However, there’s more swearing done mid workout when they get stuck and things have to pause for 10mins to fix it. Soooo, idk, for the most part they’re great, but sometimes they’re pieces of s*** that you’ll want to throw against a wall. 🤷🏻‍♀️ Still cheaper than buying all the weights separately.
customer_reviews.author: Justesen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for gome gyms
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a space saver. Some comments mentioned the plates sometimes rock a little, that they aren't really solid like a normal dumbbell. It does rock a little, but it still feels solid. Sometimes I click the weight and the handle doesn't disengage fully, so I just do a quick double click and its done. These are an amazing price for the number of dumbbells you get. I have an older CAP 1" dumbbell system with plates that are 1" ID so I can go above 52.5 lbs. If you're doing rows or something where you can pull a lot of weight you'll need an auxiliary heavy dumbbell. Overall extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Should last longer that 13 months
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVED these weights. Until today. I set them down and the plastic on the bottom BROKE off and now I am unable to load the right amount of weights on one of the hand pieces. I would rate them 4 stars, as sometimes they don't catch or load right and a few times some of the weights have fallen off or come out when lifting the handles out and you have to figure out where the piece goes before you can get them back in place. I have reached out to the company about a getting a replacement- will update rating after getting in touch with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the bucks
customer_reviews.text: These free-weights were a bit more than I wanted to spend but the space-saving and range of weights is well worth it. The mechanism that engages the varied weights is super smart and certain when they lock in. The only adjustment for lifting is the length of them is the same regardless of the weight so the lighter settings are still pretty long. It's easy to get used to, however, and the grips are very comfortable. The flat side also keeps them from running away when you set them on the floor. I'm very, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These weights are a much cheaper alternative to buying multiple dumbbells at various weights. You simply turn the dials on the ends of the weights to select the weight and let it rip. Mine are sturdy and are easy to hold. You do not want to drop or slam these, plus they only go to 55lbs, so there is no point in dropping. I use these for chest and shoulder presses and flies, bicep curls, skull crushers, triceps kick backs, and more. These are reliable and easy to use, so I highly suggest them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice weights but overall length is a bit cumbersome for some exercises
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for P90X3. They are great for most workouts but the large physical size of them makes some of the moves very difficult. There is one exercise where you are on your side, propped up with one arm, and you need to pass the weight between your torso and your arm that is supporting you on the floor. Easy to do with standard weights but since these are quite a bit longer, additional wrist movements were required to pass the weight through the window created between torso and arm. Otherwise the weights are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it / Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Great! Great!
customer_reviews.text: Update: 3 months in and I must say these are the best selection of dumbbells I’ve ever seen. Those who complain about the locking and not working either are very unlucky or simply abuse the dumbbell. I take excellent care of mine and do not throw them around. I follow the directions of usage and they have served my VERY well! Recommend! Only have had it a couple weeks. So far it has met my expectations perfectly. No troubles. I think if I take care of the set they will remain great.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstar5

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but really good if you can manage the weight limitation
customer_reviews.text: The weight limitation is okay for most people. It allows to still have some range of motion. However, when you are using weight under 30 pounds you may feel the dumbbell to be tall. Nonetheless, I have been using them for 2 months and I do not regret. I am careful to not drop them. Changing weight is super quick and the mechanism feels right.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic equipment once you can set it up the first time
customer_reviews.text: Once I unpacked one of the dumb-bell worked fine. The other seemed to be stuck. Which apparently is a common problem if you see the other comments. However, the step mentioned of turning it upside down and whacking the bottom didn't really work. A quick search on the internet on Bowflex adjustable weights stuck led to a youtube video from the company. That worked fine. Once I got it working I am able to use it fine for the past week. Now finally I have what I need to be somewhat fit while in COVID lockdown
customer_reviews.author: Abhi

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job, seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Great set of weights. Have had it for over a month now and it does the job. Seems very durable and adjusting weights is smooth and pulling it out of the holder and reinserting is easy. The only thing that is annoying is that the dumbbells are longer than what you expect so it is harder to do lifts that require bring your arms close together. If you are used to gym dumbbell weights then this extra length will certainly annoy you at first. It just takes some readjusting.
customer_reviews.author: RanBigBuyer

customer_reviews.title: winner winner!
customer_reviews.text: We were hoping to order a pair of these before our baby girl arrived, and then Coronavirus took over the world. It's been REALLY difficult to get our hands on personal fitness equipment for our house. We got lucky and ordered a set of these, and they are perfect! We didn't trust ordering from a 3rd party seller so we waited until we could get them directly from Amazon. We are very happy with this purchase, and would recommend these weights to anyone. It's much easier than storing all the different size weights.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Revak

customer_reviews.title: NOT Bowflex
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Used-Like New set of Bowflex adjustable dumbbells. I got a new set of Dumbbells, not Blowflex. These are obviously not Bowflex and not what I paid for. I've used Bowflex before and the action when changing weights was smooth, these do not seem to have that same quality. One dumbbell came with the safety feature, described in another review, in tact, while the second did not. As I was removing the dumbbell from the box, one side came apart and several weight plates detached, landing directly on top of my foot causing injury. This is very disappointing, and painful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better alternative than a full range of weights for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Compact. Doesn't take much room for a great range of weights. Quick and easy to swap weight amounts. The grips are nice. Good build quality. Cons: They're a little large, physically. Specifically, they're very wide, which makes a few movements a little more awkward. More points of failure. I don't have much reason to worry currently, but there are a lot more moving parts than, well, zero, on a regular dumbbell. I'm definitely more careful with these than I would be with regular weights.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Nice versatile set of dumbells
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility of these dumbbells! I used a pair of these years ago, but never had a pair of my own. Bought a set when they were on sale to help build out my home gym. I didn't want a fell set of dumbbells that'd take up a lot of space so these are perfect. They're easy to adjust and comfortable in the hand. Gave 4 stars because occasionally one of the dumbbells locks up and can't be adjusted. It's a pretty easy and quick fix, but still a pain when it happens in the middle of a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Andy R

customer_reviews.title: Best set of adjustable weights out there.
customer_reviews.text: These Dumbells work great they are so easy to change the weights. You can do one set at one weight and quickly change to another weight for your next set. They only go up to 52.5 lbs a piece which is fine for me. I'm 66 and not really a powerlifter just want to stay in shape and not lose too much muscle mass. My son who benches 300lbs thinks they are too light, but uses them anyway. Oh tried to buy a used set on Craigslist but these hold their value so for about $20 more I bought them brand new on Amazon. Great purchase really like the quick change feature.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not bowflex brand.  Complete fake, no name dumbells
customer_reviews.text: Description says bow flex .. it is NOT bow flex brand. Absolutely no name brand. Description is very deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to adjust! But kinda long.
customer_reviews.text: The spinning dial to adjust these is REALLY easy to use. You can do it with one hand easily, and it doesn't get stuck like some other systems. The other thing worth mentioning is the size. These are really long dumbbells, so some exercises can seem awkward. And because of their length, they feel a bit heavier when compared to the same weight setting of a more compact design. But I love them! Definitely worth it 💪
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Becker

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Switches between weight easily and quickly, and the base makes it easy to move the weights back and forth from the living room as needed. The weight does stick sometimes; when I go to switch the weight, sometimes it doesn't want to come back out of the base and I have to jiggle it loose. But I have family who also use Bowflex adjustable dumbbells and they have never had this issue, so it might be either this particular pair or (more likely) user error.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of some additional weights but didn't want to buy each weight size individually, because that gets expensive really fast. With these, there is an initial investment but if you do the math you're saving a ton of money not buying each size on its own. These have their own stand, for each handheld weight. The dial on the end of each weight is really big so you can clearly see what size you're adjusting to. While yes, these are pretty big and bulky to use sometimes, it beats the heck out of having 47,000 individual weights laying around. Couldn't recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: KayEmJay's Favorite Things!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Great option for my workout room. Was having to change plates on my dumbbells too frequently. Now I don't. Easy to change weights quickly with these. I'm careful with all my weights so no adjustment required for me. If you drop or toss your weights, these are not for you. The larger size was easy to adjust to. The DVD was a nice touch. Instead of buying the recommended stand, I made a wood base and used heavy duty velcro to attach the base that holds each dumbbell to my existing weight rack. Works nicely. With care, these should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: FES

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Durable Product That Requires Little Space
customer_reviews.text: This is a weight-selectable set of dumbells that are covered in plastic to prevent rust and stains to flooring. The selectable weight for each dumbbell in 2.5 lb increments from 5-52 pounds. The great thing about these is how little space they consume in a room. They have a great feel and are very well made. The instructions recommend not dropping the dumbbells or using the grips to perform push ups. I highly recommend these for anyone who uses them properly and avoids abusing the product.
customer_reviews.author: gambit77

customer_reviews.title: Good but Powerblock is better
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in the other reviews, it is longer than the standard dumbbell which limits the range of motion on some exercise. Comparing to Powerblock, this set cannot be upgraded and you need to separately purchase the 90 lb set. So overall I would recommend Poweblock. However, the build quality is pretty good and the handle is more comfortable (to me) than powerblock.
customer_reviews.author: Hang Pei

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, effiecient, but durable?
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, on a superficial level, these things are pretty. While it may be irrelevant to some, most people looking to save on space might be required to have these in their space. They look sharp. Hands down the best looking adjustable dumbbells. Aside from that, they function very well. Easy to understand. The time it takes to change into another weight can be your rest time between sets anyway. The con would be that the material of the weights themselves is not indestructible. It would surely crack if dropped on the wrong surface. I don't believe there is any purposeful reason for weight drops at a weight this low, but accidents can happen.
customer_reviews.author: DKozaKM

customer_reviews.title: Saves me a gym membership
customer_reviews.text: Been going to gyms for years. The gym by my house started to get really busy all the time so I bought some home workout equipment to skip the nonsense. This was part of it. I absolutely love them. Easy to switch between weights. Never had a problem with them mechanically doing any kind of workout. The workout DVD that came with the dumbbells was actually very informative. I highly suggest watching it.
customer_reviews.author: John Compton

customer_reviews.title: Get these! They are versatile, comfortable and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: You can’t beat this setup! So easy it’s almost self explanatory. I love these weights because I’m no longer having to wait at the gym for dumbbells and these have a comfortable grip. With my bench and these dumbbells there are endless exercises available. It’s a home gym for me now. Get em you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Two

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the convenience and the product
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had time to go to the gym but that is not in the cards for me. I hated constantly changing plates for different weights and different exercises and this really fits the bill. Yes, you need to read the instruction but if you actually read and follow them, the product works EXACTLY as advertised. I have been using for a few months now and am very pleased. Thinking about the stands but haven't pulled the trigger yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant in form and function
customer_reviews.text: I tried another brand of adjustable dumbbells that were horrible and a bit scary. It used pin selected weights. These take it to a new level. With a simple dial selector and an impressive locking design, you needn't worry about a weight plate falling off in use. As you turn the dials, they click into the next setting. After a while, you can change them just by the sound. Very solid with comfortable grips. Instructions include a comprehensive guide to the various exercises you can use with the kit. Comes with two baseplates, which are part of the locking design.
customer_reviews.author: George Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used these 6 days a week for 4 months now and they’re solid. I way prefer these over individual dumbbells. They’re comfortable and easy to adjust. BUT...get the separate bow flex stand for these. They’re easier to access than straight off the ground, and you’ll take better care of them because they’ll take up a place like a piece of furniture. The stand was like $140 but I’m my opinion it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Have to be careful placing weights in base
customer_reviews.text: Within the first three days of use, the tab on the base (first picture- silver tab on right) which depresses the dial lock button on the dum bell was bent down. This made the corresponding dial attached to this base almost impossible to turn until I bent the tab back into place (second picture). Be careful putting dumb bells back in the base. It's not much fun being careful putting full weight dumb bells in their base when your arms are spent. Shouldn't be a problem if you use lower weight.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: REALLY AN EXCEPTIONAL PRODUCT ALL AROUND.  GREAT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor had mentioned this product to me. Then went and checked out at Dick's Sporting Goods. Really impressive. Neighbor & his brother each had a set going on 10 years & said it had held up just fine with reasonable care. No type of maintenance really required. That took care of that concern--durability. Used them yesterday for 1st time. GREAT RUBBER Center Grip compared to most dumbbells. Very easy to use. Saves tons of space compared to having individual weights. Really happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sal G.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: The weights get stuck on the base and the rotating dial gets stuck as well. I spend more time trying to get the dial to turn and “resetting” the dumbbells as I do actually using them. These issues happened from the moment I unboxed them. For such an expensive purchase I’m kicking myself over a complete waste of money on a POS product.
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: A great solution when you cannot go to the gym....
customer_reviews.text: I have the 40 lb kettle bell made by Bowflex but wanted and waited for the dumbbells to become available again. I like the concept, works well, takes very little space compared to a rack of weights ranging up to 52 lbs. My only complaint is one of the rubber grips moves up and and I have to bring it back down. Might contact Bowflex to see what can be done, and why I only gave it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Owen H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set.
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a gift from my wife. Get the stand too! When the box arrives, take them out of the box at the delivery location (mine was in front of my garage. The box is about 120lbs (54-55 kg). Taking them out one by one makes life easier. DO NOT bang them around too much. The plates that holds the dumbbells is essential their operations. You cannot dial the weight unless the Dumbbell are in the plate.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Beckman

customer_reviews.title: For big and little muscles. . .
customer_reviews.text: Meet me start out with I hate working out! These weights are SO easy to use that even I am willing to use them! Shocking I know. I have to say my husband loves them. They are durable (my son dropped them on my hardwoods and they did not break) so easy to switch the weight setting. I can switch weights while my husband is using it for him. All in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: casey hiam

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: This weight set has replaced 3 sets of weights! Great grips, easy weight changes, and wide plates for single dumbbell work. The weight range is perfect for me. I like to start a new exercise with a lower weight to get control of the movement and then move up. Just be sure when you switch weight the dial clicks into place. Otherwise the weight won't release from the base.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I love this weight set. Easy to adjust the weight and I haven't had any issues with it so far. I was lucky enough to buy it before people started price gouging. I hope Amazon does something about all the people price gouging during this pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: BTIBT

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT
customer_reviews.text: It’s counterfeit!!! They sent a fake one!!! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: George Sultani

customer_reviews.title: Good enough, but not made to last
customer_reviews.text: As far as pandemic home gym equipment goes these are ok for beginning your own setup. Pros: - Changing weight is fast and easy - Less expensive, when on sale, than some of the alternatives Cons: - Coating on the handles started to corrode and flake within a few months despite maintenance and precautions - They are wider than a normal dumbbell, so some movements can feel awkward - Dials and weights can jam if you're not careful or know how to avoid the issue
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Heller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Despite having to return the first set because one dumbbell wouldn’t lock weight on, we are really happy with this set. We live in a tiny apartment with a toddler and don’t have space for a big rack of weights so this set is awesome and tucks right into a corner. It’s nice that my husband and I can both get use from them. They are a little wide if you’re using lower amounts of weight but nothing unmanageable.
customer_reviews.author: Kanitha

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic parts will eventually break.
customer_reviews.text: These dumbbells are great as long as you’re very gentle with them. It’s obvious not to drop them. I wouldn’t even drop an iron dumbbell. With my first pair of Bowflex SelectTech 552 dumbbells I put them down (never leaving my hands) and one of them broke. They are made with plastic and they can’t withstand the slightest bit of roughness. I’m talking about putting them down a little hard. I got a replacement for that one and a month later the same thing happened. See pictures. It’s incredibly frustrating. Now I have these dumbbells sitting around useless and the replacement parts are very expensive. So much so I refuse to spend knowing it will break again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Garage Gym Raw

customer_reviews.title: How do folks keep breaking these?
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered my original selecttech 552 back in 2011 and they're still going as strong and as awesome. Use them on one of those gym floor puzzle mats with my bowflex adjustable bench. Almost 10 years in and not an issue. I use the full rack, meaning go from 5 to 52.5 lbs almost daily, so using the dials regularly, just carefully. I don't drop them ever, always controlled motions. I don't slam them into the tray either. Treat them with care and they return the favor. They're durable and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: LeVic

product_meta.title: Bowflex SelectTech 552 - Two Adjustable Dumbbells
product_meta.description:
With just the turn of a dial you can automatically change your resistance from 5 lbs. all the way up to 52. 5 lbs. of weight. No more picking up 30 different dumbbells to get the results you want, these adjustable dumbbells replace 15 sets of weights. All you need is this pair of SelectTech 552 Dumbbells to transform your body for good. Compatible with the free Bowflex SelectTech training App for iOS and Android.

AMAZON.COM
If you want to get a good strength workout at home, but don't have much space, the Bowflex 552 SelectTech Dumbbells are an ideal solution. Newly designed, the innovative pair of 552 SelectTech Dumbbells combines 15 sets of weights into one using a unique dial system. It's one of the most space-efficient and flexible strength-training options available with its unique and effective design. With just the turn of a dial, you can automatically change your resistance on each dumbbell from 5 pounds all the way up to 52.5 pounds of weight. It adjusts in 2.5-pound increments (up to 25 pounds), enabling you to gradually increase your strength without bulking up.

 Specifications:

 *  
   
   Change the dumbbell's weight with just the turn of a dial. 
   
   The SelectTech 552 dumbbells adjust from 5 pounds all the way up to 52.5 pounds of weight. 
 * Weight Range: 5 to 52.5 lbs (2.27 to 23.8 kg) for each dumbbell 
 * Exercises Available: 30+ 
 * Weight Settings: 15 
 * Weight Settings in pounds: 5, 7.5, 10, 12.5, 15, 17.5, 20, 22.5, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50, and 52.5 pounds 
 * Dumbbell Dimensions (Each): 15.75 inches long by 8 inches wide by 9 inches tall 
 * Weight (Each): 52.5 pounds / 23.8 kg 

 Leg Exercises:

 * Wide squats 
 * Calf raises 
 * Stationary lunges 
 * Stiff-leg dead lift 
 * Reverse lunge 
 * Side lunge 

 Back Exercises:

 * Alternating rows 
 * Wide row 
 * Dead lift 

 Chest Exercises:

 * Flat chest press 
 * Incline chest press 
 * Flat fly 
 * Incline fly 
 * Decline chest press 

 Abdominal Exercises:

 * Ab crunch 
 * Reverse crunch 
 * Lying trunk rotation 
 * Twisting side crunch 
 * Lying leg raise 

 Arm Exercises:

 * Standing curls 
 * Concentration curls 
 * Incline bench curls 
 * Scott curls 
 * Overhead triceps extension 
 * Triceps kickback 
 * Lying triceps extension 
 * Hammer curls 

 Shoulder Exercises:

 * Standing shoulder press 
 * Lateral raise 
 * Seated overhead press 
 * Front raise 
 * Rear delt row 
 * Shrugs 

 Manufacturer's Warranty
Two-year limited warranty on all parts; five-year warranty on weight plates; one-year warranty on labor
feature_bullets: Each dumbbell adjusts from 5 to 52.5 pounds; adjusts in 2.5-pound increments up to the first 25 pounds
Lets you rapidly switch from one exercise to the next
Combines 15 sets of weights into one, using a unique dial system
Eliminates the need for multiple dumbbells cluttering your workout space
Two year warranty on weight plates and parts

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
